text: You should be able to use boolean and choice fields in module.ccs. Interested to hear other's gut reactions to this.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/files#css-module-css->

> It is by design that module field values can’t change the CSS in the file. If module field values could affect the module.css file, every instance of a module’s CSS would need to be loaded separately, because every instance could be different. The result would likely be duplicate CSS and potentially conflicting styles when multiple instances of a module occur on a page.

Similar for module.js - as the solution is explained with CSS, we have an explanation for module.js as well
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/files#scripting-based-on-field-values>
So the tl;dr there are better ways of handling CSS and JS that is module instance specific that will not negatively hurt your website performance.
